metadata.title: CVE-2020-13844 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
Arm Armv8-A core implementations utilizing speculative execution pastunconditional changes in control flow may allow unauthorized disclosure ofinformation to an attacker with local user access via a side-channelanalysis, aka "straight-line speculation."

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-13844` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

cpp-9 - 9.4.0-5ubuntu1
g++-9 - 9.4.0-5ubuntu1
g++-9-multilib - 9.4.0-5ubuntu1
gcc-9 - 9.4.0-5ubuntu1

criterions.comment: gcc-3.3 package in noble is affected, but a decision has been made to defer addressing it.
gcc-9 package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '9.4.0-5ubuntu1').
gcc-10 package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '10.2.0-5ubuntu1').
gcc-9-cross package in noble is affected, but a decision has been made to defer addressing it.
